result.execSummary:
The defendant Leah Marie Lee was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Court orders time served.
Concurrent with: 13CT115, 13CM211, 14CM65, and 14CM235

records.addlTxt: 2:39 Defendant Leah Marie Lee in court with attorney Melissa M. Petersen.  Defendant Leah Marie Lee in custody.  Adam C Sticht appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 13CT115, 14CM65, 14CM235 and 15CF251. Sticht: 130 days credit. Asking for time served on 13CM211, 13CT115, 14CM65 and 14CM235. Revoke DPA on 15CF251 and time served. Atty Petersen responds. Court: all sentences are concurrent to each other: 13CM211 90 days jail with good time, 13CT115 time served, 14CM65 time served, 14CM235 90 days with good time. 15CF251; grants motion to revoke DPA and imposes time served. 2:48
To Revoke Deferred Judgment of Conviction
To Revoke Deferred Judgment of Conviction
Melissa Petersen
from Victim Witness Coordination Erin Mulhollam re: victims' reimbursement information.

03:03 Defendant Leah Marie Lee in court with attorney Lars Helmer Loberg.  Defendant Leah Marie Lee in custody.  Rory Eoin O'Sullivan appeared for the State of Wisconsin. O'Sullivan, plead to count 1, deferred judgment for 2 years. Parties agree.  Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form is filed with the court; court reviews with Def.  Constitutional rights explained to defendant.  Exam'd re: understanding of law, penalty and rights. DEF PLEADS GUILTY.  Facts are correct.  COURT ACCEPTS PLEA, FINDS DEF FREELY, INTELLIGENTLY, KNOWINGLY & UNDERSTANDINGLY MADE AND WAIVES CONSTITUTIONAL RIGHTS.  The court finds the defendant guilty but witholds judgment of conviction pending decision on deferred agreement. Parties address the court. Court signs deferred agreement. 03:16
from Atty Loberg re: Def is incarcerated in Goodhue County, ADA agreed to reschedule.
Plea hearing on March 21, 2017 at 02:45 pm.
Steven and Audrey Johnson

from Atty OSullivan to reschedule PTC. Atty Loberg has no objection.
Pre-trial conference on August 11, 2016 at 03:15 pm.

03:35 Defendant Leah Marie Lee in court, in custody VIA VIDEO CONFERENCING FROM PCJ. Attorney Lars Loberg appears via phone for the defendant. William H. Thorie appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Thorie: Defendant failed to appear for pre-trial conference.  Defendant addresses the court.  Thorie recommends cash bond to ensure appearance.  Atty Loberg recommends signature bond. Court orders $5000 signature bond reinstated. Set for pre-trial.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 11, 2016 at 03:15 pm.
PCJ Booking Sheet
Pre-trial conference on June 20, 2016 at 02:45 pm.

Information Filed with the Court and a copy is given to the defendant.    Defendant has a copy of the information  and waives reading of the information.  Defendant enters not guilty plea at preliminary hearing.  Not guilty plea received by the court.    The bond will continue as ordered.  Court reviews bond conditions with defendant.    Pretrial Conference to be set.

11:29 a.m.  Defendant Leah Marie Lee in court with attorney Lars Helmer Loberg.  Rory Eoin O'Sullivan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Written waiver of preliminary hearing is filed and the court reviews with the defendant.  Court finds defendant freely, intelligently, knowingly, and understandingly made and waives constitutional right to a preliminary hearing.    The court finds probable cause and binds defendant over for further proceedings.
